page.title: 07THE GOLF COURSE,LEE.
page.content: Lee-on-the-Solent Golf Course covers an area of approximately two square kilometres and is a veritable oasis of greenery.It is surrounded mainly by agricultural land and grazing land.It is difficult to realise that there are housing estates very close at hand when all around are panoramic views of typically Southern English countryside.A public footpath meanders through the golf course providing a very pleasant walk through open spaces,although one has to be aware of high speed golf balls.As well as strollers ,the footpath also attracts local boys who like to skirmish in the undergrowth searching for errant golf balls. Alongside the path stands Rose Cottage still sporting its old Sun Fire insurance plaque and number.In the cottage garden are several bee hives.
